data.title: Xerox History Timeline
data.meta_description: View the Xerox history timeline highlighting business innovation, research and design, cutting edge technology and rich brand history
data.text:
2019

Dec. 20, 2019: Xerox received a Gold Tier Award for the responsible management of electronic waste at the 2019 Sustainable Materials Management (SMM) Electronics Challenge Awards Ceremony

Hosted by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). The SMM Electronics Challenge is the EPA’s annual awards ceremony recognizing participants for their commitment to sustainable materials management and responsible recycling, honoring those companies who, in the U.S., voluntarily engage in recycling programs.

Dec. 3, 2019: At the inaugural UiPath Automation Excellence Awards held in Bangalore, India, Xerox captured the award for best project in Non-Finance Telecom, Technology and Media companies.

UiPath is a leading Robotic Process Automation (RPA) vendor, which provides a complete software platform to help organizations efficiently automate business processes. These inaugural awards honored companies across different areas that have most successfully implemented the UiPath platform. In addition to the award Xerox won in the Technology & Media category and nominated for awards in Most Innovative Implementation and Best Competency Building.

Nov. 20, 2019: Xerox named a top employer in Canada for 2020 by Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Mediacorp Canada Inc.

This award is Canada’s leading best employers award, and is a national competition to determine which employers are front-runners in their industries in offering exceptional workplaces for their employees. Employers are evaluated by the editors of Canada’s Top 100 Employers using select criteria, including physical workplace, work atmosphere and social engagement, employee communications, and community involvement.

Nov. 15, 2019: Xerox Chief Commercial Officer Joanne Collins Smee is named a ‘Moves Power Woman 2019’ by New York Moves Magazine

Award recipients lead by example, are accommodating and flexible by nature, yet strong and immovable on points of principle; always determined but never unaware of circumstance.

Nov. 12, 2019: On the 2020 Most JUST Companies list Xerox is No. 189 on the overall list of 922 and No. 7 out of 38 in the Commercial Support Services industry.

Overall score of 56.3. Highlights for Xerox in the Commercial Support Services Industry:

No. 1 out of 38 for Communities

No. 2 out of 38 for Environment

No. 3 out of 38 for Customers

No. 5 out of 38 for Shareholders

Nov. 18, 2019: The Xerox Baltoro HF won gold in the Technology division with the “Most Progressive Printing Process, Production Inkjet” at the 14th Annual Canadian Printing Awards.

Oct. 2, 2019: A RED HOT Technology Vanguard Pioneer Award was given to the Xerox Baltoro™ HF Inkjet Press at the Print 19 trade show.

In addition, the Xerox Adaptive CMYK Plus Technology for the C60/C70 Printer also won a RED HOT Technology Award in the product category.

Sept. 16, 2019: LATINA Style Magazine named Xerox among the 50 best companies for Latinas.

Xerox and its programs are highlighted in the LATINA Style 50 report, a respected analysis of corporate America’s efforts to promote diversity and provide career advancement opportunities for Hispanic-Latinos in the workplace. LATINA Style gave Xerox top marks for its commitment to diversity programs that recruit and retain Latinas, women, veterans and military personnel, and increase the number of Latina employees at the company. The magazine is endorsed and was created with the assistance of the U.S. Department of Labor, the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, women and national Hispanic organizations.

Sept. 16, 2019: Xerox is No. 29 on the 2019 global “Top 100 Most Diverse & Inclusive Companies” Refinitiv Diversity & Inclusion Index.

The Index ranks over 7,000 companies globally and identifies the top 100 publicly traded companies with the most diverse and inclusive workplaces.

July 30, 2019: Xerox included on the Diversity Best Practices (DBP) Inclusion Index, a division of Working Mother Media.

The index measures diversity practices in employee recruiting, retention and career advancement, overall company culture, and demographics and transparency. Xerox was one of only 80 companies to achieve a 60% or higher rating.

June 14, 2019: Newsweek named DocuShare and Managed Print Services to the 2019 list of Best Business Tools.

The nationwide survey named Xerox among the top 10 Document Management Software (DMS) providers, and in an even shorter list of Enterprise Content Management (EMC) providers. Xerox DocuShare was also recognized as a Gen Z favorite with the highest score among the Gen Z users surveyed. Xerox Managed Print Services also ranked among the best in its category. Newsweek and Statista Inc., a globally recognized data research company, surveyed more than 10,000 professional users and 1,500 Gen Z users, the latest generation graduating from college and entering the workforce, to name the top providers of business software and software services in 54 categories.

June 7, 2019: Xerox ranked as a 2019 “Best Places for Women & Diverse Managers to Work" by DiversityMBA, a national leadership organization integrating diversity and inclusion with talent management.

Diversity MBA’s survey showcases companies that make a strategic effort to implement intentional strategies for women and managers of diverse backgrounds to advance to leadership roles. The development of emerging leaders is a focus for this year’s survey, as well as how impactful companies are sustaining inclusive cultures.

June 6, 2019: Xerox wins the Managed Service Provider (MSP) Innovation Best Practice Award from Channel Partner Insights for the company's MPS Accreditation program.

May 15, 2019: For the 11th consecutive year, Xerox is named in the 100 Best Corporate Citizens list by Corporate Responsibility Magazine, a leading voice on corporate responsibility.

The list recognizes the standout environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance among the 1,000 largest U.S. public companies. Corporate Responsibility Magazine ranks companies in seven categories: climate change, employee relations, environment, financial, governance, human rights, and stakeholders and society. Xerox and the other companies making the list are recognized for their commitment, transparency, and tackling ESG challenges head-on.

April 15, 2019: Xerox has been named one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for 2019 by MediaCorp Canada

This is the third year Xerox has been recognized, scoring top marks for commitment to creating environmentally-friendly products and solutions that generate less waste for employees and clients. Canada’s Greenest Employers are recognized annually for their leadership in creating environmental awareness through exceptional earth-friendly initiatives that help attract people and talent to their company because of their environmental leadership.

March 28, 2019: Xerox has been recognized as one of the "Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality"

Xerox has earned a 100% score for 17 years, every year since the inception of the report, further demonstrating our long history and commitment to diversity. The Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Foundation’s 2019 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) report is the premier national benchmarking tool that assess LGBTQ-inclusive workplace policies and practices. Employers earning top ratings took concrete steps to ensure greater equity for LGBTQ workers and their families in the form of comprehensive policies, benefits and practices.".

March 16, 2019: Xerox is ranked No. 70 on Reputation Institute's Gobal RepTrak 100.

The global survey reveals how stakeholders perceive companies and how those perceptions affect purchasing behavior.

March 7, 2019: Xerox is ranked No. 70 on the Forbes list of the "World’s Most Reputable Companies" up from No. 73 in 2018.

The ranking highlights the top 100 most reputable companies based on a survey by Reputation Institute of more than 230,000 people in 15 countries from January to February 2019. Companies considered typically have revenue in excess of $50 billion, a presence in all surveyed countries and brand familiarity with at least 40% of the general population.

March 2, 2019: Xerox's Chief Human Resources Officer Suzan Morno-Wade and Chief Information Security Officer Chief Dr. Alissa Abdullah Receive Black Enterprise “Most Powerful Women in Corporate America” award

The editorial team of Black Enterprise develops the list of women and chooses women whom are among a select group of corporate leaders who continue to shatter the perpetual glass ceiling and manage significant lines of business or serve as representatives on the executive leadership teams of the top 1,000 publicly traded U.S. corporations. They also contribute to the development of the business, operational and financial policies and strategies of their companies holding C-suite positions with global responsibilities.

February 8, 2019: Xerox is ranked No. 70 on Barron’s 2nd annual 2019 "100 Most Sustainable Companies" listing

Xerox was No. 83 on the first annual 2018 list. Barron’s uses Calvert Research and Management for the survey and reviews the 1,000 largest publicly held companies by market value, with headquarters in the U.S., as of Dec. 31. Calvert looked at 300 performance indicators for each company from data providers including Institutional Shareholder Services, Sustainalytics, and Thomson Reuters Asset4 in five categories: shareholders, employees, customers, planet, and community.

January 18, 2019: Xerox Canada is a Top 2019 Employer for Young People

MediaCorp Canada recognized the employers that offer the nation's best workplaces and programs for young people just starting their careers. The employers on this list are Canada's leaders in attracting and retaining younger employees to their organizations.

January 7, 2019: Xerox Duplex Portable Scanner received Better Buys 2019 Innovative Product of the Year Award in the scanners category

Each product is individually evaluated and compared against the competition on a range of criteria, including: Unique Features, Value to the customer and Price.

January 1, 2019: Xerox Canada is a Top 100 2019 Employer

This is Canada’s leading best employer’s award given out by MediaCorp Canada. It is a national competition to determine which employers are front-runners in their industries in offering exceptional workplaces for their employees.

January 1, 2019: Xerox Canada is a Top 2019 Employer in the Greater Toronto Area

This is regional MediaCorp Canada competition to determine front-running employers in the Greater Toronto Area.

Back to Top ^

2018

December 21, 2018: Xerox is included again on BLACK ENTERPRISE’s 2018 Best Companies for Diversity list.

This is a roster of corporations that have demonstrated best practices through their diverse representation within their employee base, senior management ranks, corporate boards, and supplier pools.

December 10, 2018: For the second year in a row Xerox’s Global Partner Program has won the Channelnomics 2018 Innovation Award.

The Channelnomics Innovation Awards (CIAs) recognize channel players across North America who bring innovation, forward thinking and excitement to the channel. The awards recognize achievements by solution providers, distributors and vendors in 30 categories and are based solely on innovation and achievement in the North American channel over the past year.

December 10, 2018: Xerox named one of America’s 2018 Most JUST Companies.

This is Xerox’s second year on the list for outperforming peers on issues including worker pay and treatment, job creation, community involvement and providing products that improve life and do not harm the environment, according to Forbes and JUST Capital, a nonprofit that ranks the largest publicly-traded corporations in the United States on the issues Americans care about most.

December 7, 2018: Xerox is named one of the Top Employers for the Greater Toronto Area for 2019 by Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

In its 13th year, the Greater Toronto's Top Employers competition is an editorial project that recognizes employers with exceptional HR programs and forward-thinking workplace policies. Editors at Mediacorp grade employers on eight criteria: (1) Physical Workplace; (2) Work Atmosphere & Social; (3) Health, Financial & Family Benefits; (4) Vacation & Time-Off; (5) Employee Communications; (6) Performance Management; (7) Training & Skills Development; and (8) Community Involvement.

November 28, 2018: Xerox wins Buyers Lab’s coveted 2019 Document Imaging Software Line of the Year award.

This annual award recognizes the vendor that offers the most complete software portfolio across the range of document imaging solutions categories that Buyers Lab covers on its bliQ subscription service.

November 20, 2018: Xerox's Workplace Suite receives the 2019 Pick Award for Outstanding Job Management & Mobile Print Solution.

November 14, 2018: Xerox Spain is ranked for the third consecutive year as one of the top companies in Spain for actively promoting diversity and gender equality.

This prestigious diversity recognition is given by the human resources consulting firm INTRAMA, which chooses the top 30 organizations who are the best example of how enabling a diverse and innovative workforce drives business results and a better working environment. Xerox is in good company this year along with Accenture, Santander, Indra, P&G, SAP, Vodafone, Coca-Cola and others.

November 12, 2018: Xerox named a top employer in Canada for 2019 by Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Mediacorp Canada Inc.

This award is Canada’s leading best employers award and is a national competition to determine which employers are front-runners in their industries in offering exceptional workplaces for their employees. Employers are evaluated by the editors of Canada’s Top 100 Employers using select criteria, including physical workplace, work atmosphere and social engagement, employee communications, and community involvement. Employers are compared to other organizations in their field to determine which offers the most progressive and forward-thinking programs.

November 8, 2018: The Xerox Iridesse Production Press named top 'Most Progressive Printing Technology: Digital' by the PrintAction Canadian Printing Awards.

October 30, 2018: Xerox India ranked for the first time as a "Top 100 Best Company for Women in India."

Xerox was specifically recognized by Working Mother and the AVTAR Group for its safety, security and work-life benefit programs.

October 16, 2018: Xerox received the McAfee OEM Innovator of the Year Award at the McAfee MPower Cybersecurity Summit

Xerox and McAfee's partnership in security provides customers with timely visibility to cyberthreats, centralized management and compliance with enterprise security policies.

September 26, 2018: Xerox with XMPie were RED HOT Technology honorees, receiving special recognition from the Association for Print Technologies as “must see” attractions at the Print 18 show.

Xerox’s four RED HOT Technology recognitions are:

Xerox Iridesse Production Press with Exclusive Color FLX

Xerox Iridesse Production Press Augmented Reality Demonstrations

Xerox FreeFlow® Core Iridesse Accelerator

Customized Envelope Feeder and Conveyor for the Xerox Versant® Family of Presses

XMPie’s three RED HOT Technology recognitions are:

XMPie Circle PersonalEffect Edition

XMPie Adobe Sign Integration

XMPie StoreFlow and MyVirtualCSR Integration

September 21, 2018: Xerox achieved a perfect 5.0 ranking in each of the FTSE4Good index environmental, social and governance categories.

For the overall environmental, social and goverance Xerox had a 96 out of 100.

September 13, 2018: The Xerox Security Summit honored as the “Best Security Event” in the inaugural Channelnomics Security Awards.

The Security Summit, a comprehensive day of presentations and panels, featured cybersecurity experts and drew more than 200 Xerox vendors, channel partners and customers. The Channelnomics award recognizes the value the Xerox event brought to the channel partner community, giving them insights into how a solid cybersecurity offering can help them differentiate in a crowded, competitive marketplace.

August 18, 2018: Xerox named best workgroup color printers on CRN’s 2018 Annual Report Card (ARC).

Xerox edged out HP in this category with overall score of 77.5. That included receiving the top scores in production innovation, support and managed print services. HP was close behind with a score of 76.5. The Annual Report Card details solution provider satisfaction across product innovation, support and partnership for the hardware, services and software vendors they team up with.

August 15, 2018: Xerox named among U.S. Veterans Magazine’s top places for veterans to work and recognized as a top supplier in diversity.

August 13, 2018: Xerox Mexicana recognized for the seventh consecutive year as a "Healthy Organization" by the Distinctive Healthy Organization's (ORS) stage 5, Modeling of conduct, granted by the Workplace Wellness Council-Mexico.

July 11, 2018: The Xerox Duplex Portable Scanner honored by Keypoint Intelligence as a Leading Scanner Makers in the Outstanding Mobile Scanner category.

July 11, 2018: The Xerox AltaLink C8030 and AltaLink C8035 devices each win a coveted BLI Summer 2018 Pick award in the Copier MFP category.

Picks acknowledge the products that gave the best performances in Buyers Lab’s extensive suite of lab tests in the previous six months.

June 27, 2018: Xerox ranked as a 2018 "Best Places for Women & Diverse Managers to Work" by Diversity MBA

Diversity MBA’s survey showcases companies that make a strategic effort to implement intentional strategies for women and managers of diverse backgrounds to advance to leadership roles. The pipeline development of emerging leaders is a focus for this year’s survey, as well as how impactful companies are with sustaining inclusive cultures and talent retention. Xerox ranked No. 12.

June 19, 2018: Xerox is named to the Euronext Vigeo index: U.S. 50; the 50 most advanced technology companies in the United States.

The Euronext Vigeo index recognizes companies who do business in Europe for achieving the most advanced environmental, social and governance performances.

June 14, 2018: Xerox with partner Text 100 was recognized at PRSA Rochester’s annual PRism Awards event.

Awards were received in the Media Relations category with the "Corporate PRism Award for the Xerox Set The Page Free Launch" and in the Global Communications category with the "Corporate PRism Award for the Xerox ConnectKey Product Launch." The ConnectKey campaign also took home the coveted Best of Show award in the corporate category.

May 14, 2018: Internet Retailer has ranked North America's leading web merchants in the 2018 Top 500 Database and Analysis Report.

Xerox's overall top 500 ranking is No. 190 and No. 6 in the primary merchandise category of Office Supplies.

May 7, 2018: Xerox has been named to the “100 Best Corporate Citizens List” by Corporate Responsibility Magazine for the 10th consecutive year.

Corporate Responsibility (CR) Magazine recognized Xerox for its programs that work to nurture a greener world, create diverse and inclusive workplaces, and strong, viable communities where its employees and customers work and live. CR Magazine ranks companies in seven categories: environment; climate change; employee relations, human rights; corporate governance; financial performance; philanthropy and community support. According to the magazine, companies included on the list “deliver on their commitments to transparency and accountability in highly competitive industries.”

April 27, 2018: Xerox is among winners of Channelnomics MSP Awards 2018 by receiving “Highly Commended” honor in the Best MSP Partner Program category.

April 12, 2018: Xerox Wins Esteemed Design Award for WorkCentre 6515 Color MFP.

With its smart and simple design and all-new smartphone-like user interface (UI), the Xerox WorkCentre 6515 Color Multifunction Printer (MFP) has won a prestigious 2018 iF DESIGN AWARD from the International Forum Design GmbH. Winners of this coveted competition include brands such as Apple, BMW, Fitbit and Philips. Xerox’s award-winning look was developed by a global team of product designers from Xerox and Fuji Xerox in Japan. The WorkCentre 6515 won in the highly competitive Computer category with more than 6,400 entries from 54 countries, featuring printers, scanners, copiers, laptops, tablets and even robotics.

April 2, 2018: Xerox’s Global Partner Program has been named a 5-Star Award-Winning program as a part of CRN’s 2018 Partner Program Guide.

The 5-Star rating is given to programs whose overall rating is among the elite.

March 1, 2018: Xerox shortlisted for two 2018 Channel Middle East Awards in “Best Vendor Channel Program of the Year” and “Printing & Consumables Vendor of the Year.”

February 19, 2018: The Xerox Duplex Portable Scanner received Better Buys Editor’s Choice Award for first-quarter 2018 in the scanners category.

The Editor’s Choice Award is given out to a select group of office equipment products as a sign of excellence in quality, performance, and value.

February 15, 2018: Xerox recognized as a 2017 "2020 Women on Boards Winning 'W' Company" for the 7th consecutive year.

Xerox is one of 1151 companies to achieve having 20% or more of their board seats held by women.

February 12, 2018: Ethisphere Institute names Xerox as one of the 2018 World’s Most Ethical Companies in the Information Technology Services category.

February 8, 2018: LATINA Style magazine rates Xerox as one of the top 50 companies in 2017 for Latinas to work in the U.S.

Xerox was recognized for its efforts in promoting diversity and providing career advancement opportunities for Hispanic women. The annual LATINA Style 50 Report highlights each company's leadership programs, employee benefits and Latina representation in senior positions.

February 3, 2018: Xerox is No. 83 on Barron’s "100 Most Sustainable Companies" listing.

Barrons used Calvert Research and Management for the survey and they began by taking the 1,000 largest publicly held companies by market value, with headquarters in the U.S., as of Dec. 31. Calvert looked at 300 performance indicators for each company from data providers including Institutional Shareholder Services, Sustainalytics, and Thomson Reuters Asset4 in five categories: shareholders, employees, customers, planet, and community.

January 23, 2018: Keypoint Intelligence – Buyers Lab awarded 13 Xerox print devices as "Winter 2018 Picks."

In addition, Xerox was named winner of BLI's prestigious "2018 Monochrome Printer and MFP Line of the Year" award. Best printers of Winter 2018: Copier MFP Winners * Xerox VersaLink B7025 — Outstanding 25-ppm Copier MFP * Xerox VersaLink B7035 — Outstanding 35-ppm Copier MFP * Xerox VersaLink C7020 — Outstanding 20-ppm Color Copier MFP * Xerox VersaLink C7025 — Outstanding 25-ppm Color Copier MFP * Xerox AltaLink C8045 — Outstanding 45-ppm Color Copier MFP * Xerox AltaLink C8055 — Outstanding 55-ppm Color Copier MFP * Xerox AltaLink C8070 — Outstanding 70-ppm Color Copier MFP Printer/MFP Winners: * Xerox VersaLink B600 Series — Outstanding Printer for Large Workgroups * Xerox VersaLink B605 Series — Outstanding Multifunction Printer for Large Workgroups * Xerox VersaLink C500 Series — Outstanding Color Printer for Mid-Size Workgroups * Xerox VersaLink C505 Series — Outstanding Color Multifunction Printer for Mid-Size Workgroups * Xerox VersaLink C600 Series — Outstanding Color Printer for Large Workgroups * Xerox VersaLink C7000 Series — Outstanding Tabloid Color Printer for Mid-Size Workgroups

January 19, 2018: Fortune Ranks Xerox on its 2018 Most Admired List.

Xerox was named one of the most admired companies in the computer industry in Fortune magazine’s annual reputation survey released. Xerox is ranked No. 3 behind overall leader Apple and ahead of other companies in the computer category such as Canon, HP and Ricoh.

January 17, 2018: Xerox was recognized among the world's most innovative companies in being named a "2018 Thomson Reuters Top 100 Global Technology Leader."

Based on a proprietary methodology that holistically assesses organizations to determine those at the forefront of the tech industry, this recognition honors a selected group of companies that have demonstrated a commitment to leadership across eight pillars of performance: Financial, Management and Investor Confidence, Risk and Resilience, Legal Compliance, Innovation, People and Social Responsibility, Environmental Impact, and Reputation. The Top 100 Global Technology Leaders are those whose final scores across the pillars outshine over 5,000 other technology companies around the world.

January 15, 2018: Xerox included on Black Enterprise's annual listing of 50 Best Companies for Diversity.

Back to Top ^

2017

December 12, 2017: Xerox was named one of America’s most JUST companies according to a survey conducted by Forbes and JUST Capital, a nonprofit that ranks the largest publicly traded corporations in the U.S. Xerox was recognized for outperforming its peers in a number of areas including worker pay and treatment, job creation, community involvement and providing products that improve life and do not harm the environment.

The JUST 100 rankings are based on one of the most comprehensive surveys ever conducted on public attitudes towards corporate behavior, involving 10,000 American respondents in 2017.

December 8, 2017: Xerox’s AltaLink devices are the first multifunction printers (MFPs) to be certified by the National Information Assurance Partnership (NIAP) under rigorous new testing standards.

The Xerox AltaLink devices received NIAP certification against the latest Common Criteria security protection profile for hardcopy devices. This new protection profile is based on the security requirements specified by United States and Japanese government agencies. NIAP is the U.S. government organization that ensures compliance with the global Common Criteria for Information Technology Security Evaluation.

December 6, 2017: Xerox is included on BLACK ENTERPRISE’s 2017 Best Companies for Diversity list.

This is a roster of corporations that have demonstrated best practices through their diverse representation within their employee base, senior management ranks, corporate boards, and supplier pools.

December 6, 2017: Xerox AltaLink C8055 Color MFP is the overall winner in the printers category in CRN's 2017 Products of the Year listing.

CRN highlights its simple installation, mobile and cloud connectivity, and security.

November 30, 2017: Xerox ranked No. 95 among "500 companies against corruption” by Mexico publication Revista Expansión.

The evaluation focused on the public commitment of companies in favor of integrity policies, not compliance.

November 29, 2017: Xerox is winner of Channelnomics Innovation Award for Global Partner Program of the Year.

Companies are recognized across North America that bring innovation, forward thinking and excitement to the channel. There are about 30 categories recognizing achievements for solution providers, distributors and vendors.

November 28, 2017: Xerox App Gallery named “Outstanding MFP App Ecosystem” by Keypoint Intelligence - Buyers Lab (BLI) in the Document Imaging Software category.

This honor recognizes the most impressive solutions evaluated by BLI during the prior 12-month test cycle. The Xerox App Gallery offers a strong collection of apps for streamlining business processes, improving end user productivity, reducing costs, and boosting security. Beyond that, Xerox is recruiting its partners to develop apps to offer in the App Gallery marketplace or through direct channels, which means there is a broader community actively developing apps to address customers’ challenges. All this development activity means customers can add new features and functionalities compatible with Xerox ConnectKey-enabled devices.

November 14, 2017: Xerox ranked in the top 25 percent as No. 72 on the 2018 B2B E-Commerce 300 listing by B2BecNews.

Companies are ranked by their 2017 B2B e-commerce Web sales only.

November 14, 2017: Xerox was awarded the 2017 Sustainability Partner award from Citigroup Inc.

Xerox was recognized for the company’s success in delivering global managed print services (MPS). The Citi Supplier Awards recognize partners that help Citi with meaningful successes, best-in-class efforts, and high levels of performance and excellence that exemplify Citi’s values, mission and principles and enhance its diversity and ethical, social and environmental impacts.

November 9, 2017: Xerox is among 13 Connecticut companies that earned a top score of 100 in the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2018 Corporate Equality Index, a measure that assesses diversity and inclusion for LGBTQ workers.

November 9, 2017: Xerox CEO Jeff Jacobson received the 2017 Achievement Award for Industry Leadership

University at Buffalo’s School of Management honored Jeff for being at the forefront of his industry and exemplary career.

October 25, 2017: The Xerox Global Security Services group has been selected as a recipient of the sixth annual CSO50 Awards

Xerox was recognized for its efforts to make information security an integral part of communicating with employees, partners and stakeholders. Two Xerox information projects, “Changing Team Culture using QwikSolver®”, and “Xerox Enterprise Cyber Threat Management Portal,” were recognized as security initiatives that demonstrate outstanding business value and thought leadership. The awards will be presented at the CSO 50 Conference + Awards in February 2018.

October 23, 2017: Xerox's Chief HR Officer Darrell Ford, Chief Commercial Officer Kevin Warren and Chief Information Security Officer Alissa Johnson were named to BLACK ENTERPRISE’s 2017 Most Powerful Executives in Corporate America

This is BLACK ENTERPRISE’s exclusive listing of the highest ranking African American executives in the nation’s 1,000 largest publicly traded companies and 100 international companies with significant U.S. operations. This honor identifies executives who are vital to the management of major corporations as members of their senior leadership team and other key positions as well as demonstrates Xerox's leadership related to excellence and inclusion at the highest levels.

October 9, 2017: Xerox DocuMate 6460 and 6480 Scanners recognized by Better Buys

The products were awarded with an Editor’s Choice Award for the fourth-quarter 2017 in the scanners category.

October 6, 2017: Xerox was ranked No. 18 on Mogul.com's "Top 100 Innovator for Diversity & Inclusion in 2017" list.

The Top 100 were determined through weighted scoring, taking into account minority representation in top leadership roles, support and resources for employees, and social contribution. Xerox was noted for have five women serving currently as Corporate Officers, and fifty-one percent of Xerox’s employees are female. Also for giving out over 100 scholarships to minority students interested in STEM and actively recruits veterans through taking part in various government initiatives such as the White House Joining Forces Initiative.

September 30, 2017: Xerox Mexico ranked on Expansión magazine’s listing of companies with the highest index of inclusion in Mexico

Xerox Mexicana was positioned at No. 21 though having a greater percentage in incentivizing and promoting its personnel in different activities, and in levels of communication between workers and hierarchies.

September 18, 2017: Xerox WorkCentre 6515/DNI named among 3 Best Laser Color Printers of 2017 by Facts Chronicle.

September 11, 2017: Xerox awarded the BLI Production Printer PRO Award 2018 for the Versant 180 Press with Fiery EX 180 EFI Printer Server n the Outstanding Color Light Production Device category.

This award is granted annually, these awards acknowledge the products that gave the best performances in BLI’s rigorous production field tests over the previous year.

September 7, 2017: Latina Style magazine listed Xerox as No. 33 on their "Top 50 Best Companies for Latinas to Work for in the U.S" listing which is an annual evaluation of over 800 corporations.

Xerox was No. 27 on 2016 list. This publication is recognized as one of the most respected source of employment and career information for Hispanic women in the country.

August 25, 2017: Xerox is named a 2017 Silver award winner in the digital printing category by Sappi.

Since 1999, Sappi’s, a global wood pulp and paper company, has been honoring print shops annually. Xerox was honored for its outstanding color printing with the iGen and is the only OEM to be honored.

August 21, 2017: Xerox named among Alliance Franchise Brands' "Suppliers of the Year."

Alliance Franchise Brands LLC recently selected its Suppliers of the Year during the company’s Marketing & Print Division’s Homecoming event in Detroit. Xerox was named the leading technology partner.

August 17, 2017: Xerox was included in the 2017 State Street Global Advisors’ (SSGA) Gender Diversity Index.

The index is comprised of US large capitalization companies that achieve the highest levels within their sectors of gender diversity on their boards of directors and in their senior leadership. More than 3,500 companies were contacted by SSGA. Xerox was also included in their 2016 index.

August 17, 2017: Xerox is this year’s winner in Workgroup Color Printers and is also sweeping the technology category in CRN's 2017 Annual Report Card Awards.

August 15, 2017: Xerox was recognized by U.S. Veterans Magazine as a Top Veteran-Friendly company in the “Best of the Best” lists in the summer print and digital issues.

August 13, 2017: Xerox ranked No. 6 on Diversity MBA Magazine's 11th annual listing of “Best Places for Women & Diverse Managers to Work”.

Xerox was No. 5 in 2016 and No. 14 in 2015.

August 1, 2017:Xerox takes home a Reader’s Choice Award from Channel Pro Network for “Best Managed Print Vendor.”

July 20, 2017: Xerox received the BLI PaceSetter in Mobile Print 2017-2018 award.

These awards recognize the manufacturers that offer the most impressive portfolios of devices and solutions to serve the mobile printing needs of their customers based on research conducted for the North American market in mid-2017.

July 20, 2017: Xerox received the BLI PaceSetter in Document Imaging Security 2017–2018 award.

This is the first-ever BLI PaceSetter awards for Document Imaging Security based on research conducted for the North American market in mid-2017.

July 20, 2017: Xerox received the BLI PaceSetter in MFP Platforms & App Ecosystems 2017–2018 award.

This award recognizes the document imaging OEMs that offer the most robust device-centric software platforms, along with the most impressive portfolios of associated apps, to help customers get the most from their equipment investment. Research conducted for the North American market in mid-2017.

July 17, 2017: Keypoint Intelligence – Buyers Lab awarded four Xerox printer and multifunction printer (MFP) lines in its Summer Pick Awards.

The Xerox VersaLink B400 was named “Outstanding Multifunction Printer for Mid-Size Workgroups” because of its support for mobile printing, ConnectKey apps and impressive feature set, including flexible media handling.

The Xerox VersaLink C400 series was named “Outstanding Color Printer for Mid-Size Workgroups” due to its access to ConnectKey apps that streamline workflows and add functionality.

The Xerox VersaLink C405 series received “Outstanding Color Multifunction Printer for Mid-Size Workgroups” based on its highly intuitive touchscreen panel that simplifies walk-up activity and access to time- and money-saving ConnectKey apps.
